Binary Search

Efficiently finds the position of a target value within a sorted array.

O(log n) Divide & Conquer Sorted Arrays 
// JavaScript
function binarySearch(arr, target) {
    let left = 0, right = arr.length - 1;
    while (left <= right) {
        const mid = Math.floor((left + right) / 2);
        if (arr[mid] === target) return mid;
        if (arr[mid] < target) left = mid + 1;
        else right = mid - 1;
    }
    return -1;
}

Quick Sort

A fast, divide-and-conquer sorting algorithm.

O(n log n) Divide & Conquer In-place 
// Python
def quick_sort(arr):
    if len(arr) <= 1:
        return arr
    pivot = arr[len(arr) // 2]
    left = [x for x in arr if x < pivot]
    middle = [x for x in arr if x == pivot]
    right = [x for x in arr if x > pivot]
    return quick_sort(left) + middle + quick_sort(right)

Dijkstra's Algorithm

Finds the shortest path from a source node to all other nodes in a weighted graph.

O((V+E) log V) Shortest Path Graph Algorithm 
// Python
import heapq

def dijkstra(graph, start):
    queue = [(0, start)]
    distances = {v: float('inf') for v in graph}
    distances[start] = 0
    while queue:
        curr_dist, u = heapq.heappop(queue)
        if curr_dist > distances[u]:
            continue
        for v, weight in graph[u]:
            distance = curr_dist + weight
            if distance < distances[v]:
                distances[v] = distance
                heapq.heappush(queue, (distance, v))
    return distances

Merge Sort

A stable, divide-and-conquer sorting algorithm.

O(n log n) Stable Divide & Conquer 
// JavaScript
function mergeSort(arr) {
    if (arr.length <= 1) return arr;
    const mid = Math.floor(arr.length / 2);
    const left = mergeSort(arr.slice(0, mid));
    const right = mergeSort(arr.slice(mid));
    return merge(left, right);
}
function merge(left, right) {
    const result = [];
    while (left.length && right.length) {
        if (left[0] < right[0]) result.push(left.shift());
        else result.push(right.shift());
    }
    return result.concat(left, right);
}

Floyd-Warshall

Computes shortest paths between all pairs of nodes in a weighted graph.

O(V¬≥) All Pairs Dynamic Programming 
// Python
def floyd_warshall(graph):
    dist = [row[:] for row in graph]
    n = len(graph)
    for k in range(n):
        for i in range(n):
            for j in range(n):
                if dist[i][j] > dist[i][k] + dist[k][j]:
                    dist[i][j] = dist[i][k] + dist[k][j]
    return dist

Kadane's Algorithm

Finds the maximum sum subarray in a 1D array.

O(n) Dynamic Programming Optimization 
// JavaScript
function maxSubArray(nums) {
    let maxSum = nums[0], currSum = nums[0];
    for (let i = 1; i < nums.length; i++) {
        currSum = Math.max(nums[i], currSum + nums[i]);
        maxSum = Math.max(maxSum, currSum);
    }
    return maxSum;
}
